unnormalised: Shopping in India has changed so much! Remember those days when you'd haggle for everything? Now, a lot of us just hop onto Flipkart or Amazon.in. You used to pay with cash, now it's all UPI and credit cards. My grandma still insists on paying with ₹500 notes though!

unnormalised: Even grocery shopping is different. D-Mart is packed every weekend, and Reliance Smart is popping up everywhere. Buying veggies used to be a trip to the local sabzi mandi where you’d argue over ₹10 for a kilo of tomatoes. Now you can order it all on BigBasket.

unnormalised: The discounts are crazy though! Sales promising up to 70% off. You see ads claiming “Buy 1 Get 1 Free" all the time. It's easy to get carried away. My friend Priya spent ₹15,000 during the Diwali sale!

unnormalised: And the online reviews! People leaving comments like "Good product, 4/5 stars" or complaining about "Delayed delivery." It's useful, but also can be overwhelming. Choosing between two similar sarees can take ages because of the sheer amount of info available!
